VIII.i.3.C.4.a
.
Specific Korean Service Requirements
Effective December 16, 2003, the Veterans Benefits Act of 2003, as codified at
38 U.S.C. 1821(c)
, provides benefits and services to children born with spina bifida who are the natural children of Veterans with covered service in Korea.
Covered service in Korea
requires
active military, naval, or air service in or near the Korean demilitarized zone (DMZ) during the period beginning on September 1, 1967, and ending on August 31, 1971, and
exposure to an herbicide agent during such service as determined by VA in consultation with the Department of Defense (DoD).
